page.title: 07The Coastline
page.content: {The difference between high and low {tide in the Channel Island area is the {greatest in the world in an open {coastal situation. On a{spring tide}the difference between high and low tide is most marked. At high tide the sea washes against the sea wall; when it goes out it leaves the upper part of the beach clean and sandy. The lower part of the shore is a huge area of low rocks and rock pools because the beach is very flat. Many people go{low water fishing}on the spring tides for bait, crabs, prawns, winkles and many other things.Children like to find creatures in the rock pools. Sometimes people get stranded on the rocks by the rapidly rising tide and have to be saved from drowning by the {emergency rescue services.
